description: Update documentation to describe the new detail level CLI option.
instructions: Locate the `README.md` file in the root directory of the project.
Open `README.md` and find the section describing the command-line interface options.
Add a clear and concise description of the new `--detail-level` CLI option to this section.
Explain what the option does and its purpose.
Locate the CLI documentation file, which is likely `docs/index.md` based on the workspace context.
Open `docs/index.md` (or the correct CLI documentation file if different).
Find the section detailing command-line options.
Add a comprehensive description of the `--detail-level` option.
Include information on the valid values for this option (e.g., 'minimal', 'normal', 'detailed').
Specify the default behavior if the option is not provided.
Ensure the language used in both `README.md` and `docs/index.md` is clear, accurate, and easy for users to understand.
Review the updated documentation to ensure it flows well and is consistent with the existing documentation style.
constraints: Documentation updates must be made in Markdown format.
The changes should be integrated into the existing structure of the documentation files.
Avoid introducing new sections unless absolutely necessary; prefer adding to existing relevant sections.
validation_criteria: The `README.md` file contains a description of the `--detail-level` option.
The CLI documentation file (`docs/index.md` or equivalent) has been updated to include details about the `--detail-level` option.
The updated documentation in both files accurately describes the functionality of the `--detail-level` option.
The valid values and default behavior of the `--detail-level` option are clearly stated in the documentation.
The documentation is easy to read and understand.
name: update_documentation_for_detail_option
